pages.text: While useful, Comparators are sometimes imprecise. I've devised a series of blocks - Triggers - that emit signals based on the contents, or lack thereof, in a target inventory or tank so my redstone can react to them.

pages.title: Fill States
pages.text: There are four such triggers for both items and fluids. They work similarly to observers, reading the block they're placed against.$(br2)  The simplest two triggers are "Empty" and "Full". What they read for should be obvious.

pages.title: Querying
pages.text: The "Has Space" trigger checks whether the block, well, has space left inside for more items or fluid. I am able to filter it, too.$(br2)  Then, there is the "Contains" trigger. It must be filtered - it checks if the block contains the item or fluid in the filter inside.
